page.title: 02Great Ouse River
page.content:
The river runs through the centre of the village. It carries much water and not a little mud towards the nearby WASH (entering near Kings Lynn).
To help the drainage of the area a pumping station (one of many) was built in 1933 about 1km from the village. This lifts water from all the local fields and drainage channels about 3m into the Ouse.
There are drainage ditches (often 2m deep) round the edge of most fields, and local roads - already narrow and twisting - require some care to avoid running down into a ditch.
A major effort is continued to keep all the waterways in good repair, and so avoid flooding.
